title: Ghana: How Doctors Deal Was Struck
text:
Nigeria: SSS Director General Not Our Member - - APC 
The striking doctors earlier declined to accept an initial arrangement by government to effect the first batch of payment on Friday. 
They, however, agreed to return to work when Haruna Iddrisu, on behalf of government, made the offer to make the first payment to the 60 doctors on Wednesday. Leadership of the striking doctors, nonetheless, vowed to resume the strike action if the 11 months salary did not hit the accounts of the 60 doctors by 4;30pm tomorrow (Wednesday). They say it will signify a lack commitment on the part of government to uphold the agreement. 
The Junior doctors have not been paid since they graduated from Medical school and began their 1-year Housemanship training with some government hospitals across the country. Below is the detailed guideline with which the Ministry uses for the payments of salaries of doctors who complete their Housemanship in the country; 
Introduction: 
The manual was developed based on the payroll procedure manual developed by the Controller and Accountant General's Department (CAGD) in line with the Financial Administration Regulation, 2004 (LI 1802). The guidelines therefore complement the Payroll Procedure Manual developed by the CAGD. 
Purpose 
The purpose of these guidelines is to outline the procedures to follow in processing salaries of members of the Ghana Medical Association without compromising the standard payroll procedures which are applicable to other public institutions. It is expected that the entire process should not exceed 3-months. 
Basis for this Guideline 
These guidelines have been developed following concerns raised by the Ghana Medical Association about challenges faced by its members in having their salaries processed. The CAGD in consultation with the GMA have identified some recruitment procedures for Medical officers which need to be factored in the payroll guidelines. The guidelines mainly cover the procedures for placement of house officers and Medical odfficers on the mechanized payroll by the Ghana Health Service (GHS). 
Guidelines for placement of House Officers 
House officers in the health sector are medical officers who complete their medical school and have tro serve their housemanship. The housemanship is, however, compulsory for medical students. These guidelines prescribe the procedure to follow in processing the salaries of house officers in the Ministry of Health (MOH). 
Medical Schools authorities in the country to submit the list of medical students who may be due for their housemanship 2 months before the completion of the medical school to the Ministry of Health. Ministry of health for financial clearance from the Ministry of Finance two days after receipt of the list of the potential house officers from medical schools. 
Ministry of Finance to process financial clearance (or provide feedback to the Ministry) for the house officers within two weeks after receipt of the request from the MOH Medical and dental council to complete posting of house officers within 2 months receipt financial clearance from MOF Heads of facilities are to submit input forms and assumptions of duty letters to the personnel processing section (PPS) of MOH within two weeks of assumption of duty by the house officers. 
MOH is to capture the data for house officers within the months of receipt of data Personnel processing section (PPS) of the MOH shall submit details of the house officers (ie staff ID) to the facilities. The CAGD should submit the payroll data to MOH (Biometric section) 1 week after data capture. 
Health facilities shall arrange and facilitate the biometric registration of the house officers within 1 month upon receipt of the data from PPS MOH send the biometric data to CAGD within one (1) month after capture CAGD shall process the salaries of the house officers within the month of receipt pf the bio-data from MOH Heads of medical facilities to complete documentation for upgrade of house officer to the senior house officers and submit same to PPS of MOH one (1) month before completing of their first year horsemanship MOH is to process the upgrading of the house of officers using the earlier financial clearance and bio-data captured (no need for financial clearance) and notify MOF/MOH accordingly. 
Guidelines for placement of Medical Officers 
The guideline prescribes the procedure to follow in the placement of medical officers. The MOH stops the salaries of the house officers after the completion of their housemanship from the payroll system. After the completion of the housemanship, the house officers are upgraded to medical officers after posting to health facilities. However, as a matter of policy, the financial clearance for the housemanship automatically expires. 
Heads of facilities are to submit reports on vacancies for medical officers to the Ministry of Health, two (2) clear months before the end of the housemanships. MOH is to liaise with Ghana Medical Association (GMA) and Medical and Dental Council (MDC) to establish the number of medical officers likely to be recruited in each year. On the basis of the above, MOH within two days of receipt of the estimates submit application for financial clearance to the MOF to respond to the request for financial clearance to MOH within two weeks of receipt of request. 
Medical officers should apply for recruitment into the facilities. Request is to be submitted to MOH/MDC is to process appointment and posting letters within one month after receipt of approval for financial clearance. Facilities are expected to submit input forms for medical officers to MOH within one week after assumption of duty at the facilities. 
MOH is to capture the data for medical officers within the months of receipt. MOH is to generate the staff IDs for staff to be submitted to MOF for biometric registration. (only for those who were not captured under housemanship) Staff bio-data to be captured within one month of receipt of data at the facility by MOF. MOF is expected to submit bio-data to CAGD within a month after capture. CAGD is expected to pay to newly recruited Medical Officers in the following month after of bio-data from MOF Ghana
